translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Kuṇḍalakesī
The Elder Nun Dhammadinnā’s Verses
“The Victor called Padumuttara,
who had gone beyond all things,🔽appeared as a Leader
a hundred thousand eons ago.🔽At that time I was in a certain family
in Haṁsavatī.
I was a clever and restrained one,

analyzed: kule aññatare ahu  para kamma kārī āsi  nipakā
translated: who did the work of others.
Padumuttara Buddha’s
most excellent disciple, Sujāta,
having left the monastery,
was going for alms.
Carrying a water pot,
I was going to fetch water.
Seeing him, with my own hands I gave him a sweet cake,
with a serene mind.
Having accepted it, he sat right there
and ate it.
Then, having taken me to his house,
I gave him food.

original: Tato me ayyako tuṭṭho,🔽akarī suṇisaṁ sakaṁ;
analyzed: tatas me ayyakaḥ tuṭṭho  akarī suṇisam saka
translated: Then my uncle, being pleased,🔽made me his wife.
Having gone with my mother-in-law,
I paid homage to the Sambuddha.
At that time he, the one who spoke the Dhamma,
the nun who was appointed,
placed me at the head of those
who had the divine eye. Having heard that, I was joyful.
Having invited the Fortunate One,
To the Leader of the World and his Community;
Having given a great gift,
I aspired for that state.
Then the Happy One said to me,
with a voice deep and resonant;
‘You who are devoted to me,
who provides for the Community,
Who is intent on listening to the True Dhamma,
with a mind that has grown in virtue;
Be happy, Bhaddā, be joyful,
you will obtain the fruit of your aspiration.
After a hundred thousand aeons,
you will be born into the Okkāka family;
You will be known by the name of Gotama,
and will be a Teacher in the world.
You will be an heir to his Dhamma,
a breast-child of the Dhamma,
and will be known as Dhammadinnā,
the Teacher’s disciple.’
Having heard that, I was joyful,
and for the rest of my life,🔽I served the Great Sage,
with a loving mind, with requisites, with the Leader.
By that good deed well done,
by the intention and aspiration,
having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
In this auspicious aeon,
the kinsman of Brahmā, of great fame,
known by the name of Kassapa,
appeared, the best of orators.
The Great Sage’s attendant,
was then the Lord of Men;
The King of Kāsi was named Kikī,
in the supreme city of Bārāṇasī.
I was his sixth daughter,
well-known as Sudhammā;
Having heard the Victor’s Teaching,
I delighted in the going forth.
Our Father did not allow us,
to go forth right there in the house;
For twenty-thousand years,
we roamed about without laziness.
The third recitation-section.
The youthful spiritual life,
the King’s daughter well-nourished;
Devoted to attending on the Buddha,
the seven sisters were full of joy.
A female ascetic, a female ascetic’s pupil,
a nun, a nun’s pupil,

analyzed: dhammā ca iva su dhammā ca
translated: Dhammā and Sudhammā,
the seventh was a donor to the Community.
Khemā and Uppalavaṇṇā,
Paṭācārā and Kuṇḍalā;
Gotamī and I,
and Visākhā was the seventh.
By those well-performed deeds,
and by the intentions and vows,
Having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa (heaven).
And in my last state of existence now,
in the supreme city of Giribbaja;
I was born into a wealthy merchant family,
and the fulfilment of all wishes.🔽When I was in my first youth,
endowed with beauty and youth,
I went to another’s family,
and lived there happily.
Having gone to the refuge of the world,
and having listened to the teaching of the Dhamma,
I attained the fruit of non-return,
my husband was a wise good man.
Then after I had received permission,
I went forth into homelessness;
Not long after that time,
I attained perfection.
Then that lay follower,
having approached me, asked:
‘Deep and subtle questions,
I answered them all.
The Victor, being satisfied with my virtue,
placed me at the head (of the nuns), saying:

analyzed: bhikkhunim dhamma kathika  na aññam passāmi edisi
translated: ‘I do not see anyone like her,🔽a nun who is a speaker on Dhamma.
As the wise Dhammadinnā,
so should you bear it, monks’;
Thus I became wise,
and was looked after by the Leader.
The Teacher was served by me,
and the Buddha’s instruction was done,
The heavy burden was laid down,
and the fetters that bound this world were destroyed.🔽For the sake of which I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
That purpose of mine has been attained,
the destruction of all the fetters.
I have mastery over the supernormal powers,
and the divine ear element;
I know the minds of others,
I am a doer of the Teacher’s word.
I know my past lives,
the divine eye is purified;
Having expelled all the pollutants,
I am pure, stainless.
My defilements have been burnt up,
I live without pollutants.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
